byline.contributor: Kate Pastor and Nate Schweber contributed reporting.
byline.original: By MARC SANTORA and SHARON OTTERMAN

abstract: Pope Francis arrives in New York City and exhorts clergy members, brothers and nuns gathered in St Patrick's Cathedral to live humbly, warning them against measuring success of their ministries as they would a business; cautions them about surrounding themselves with material comfort, particularly pointed remark given renovation of the Fifth Avenue cathedral.
lead_paragraph: Francis spoke to hundreds of clergy at St. Patrick’s Cathedral in Manhattan on Thursday evening, after delivering a call to action in Washington.

headline.main: Arriving in Manhattan, Pope Tells Clergy to Serve Humbly
headline.print_headline: Arriving in New York, Pope Tells Clergy to Serve Humbly
